title: What are good resources to help with a job hunt? - Quora

response.answer_text: Start with Linkedin: World's Largest Professional Network - File out your Profile- Use your email contacts to build your network.- Join groups in the area your are interested in. Also search for local networking groups and join them.- Participate in the groups.- Read through the Pulse (news) everyday. Follow career advice and specific topics and people you are interested in. Use one search. all jobs. Indeed.com to get an idea of the local job market.- Set up saved searches to be emailed of updates.- Look through the job descriptions and find the key words the companies are using and put them on your resume and LinkedIn Profile.- You can also get salary information on there: Salary Search | Indeed.com Use Glassdoor – an inside look at jobs & companies to review any companies you are interested in. People tend to only write bad reviews so it will be skewed slightly. But, a company with a 1.5 rating is probably a lot worse then an average company rating. For in person networking, use Find your people - Meetup to find professional and social groups to network. Search for professional groups in your area. Most will also have a LinkedIn presence. Connect and network. Also look into volunteering. VolunteerMatch - Where Volunteering Begins It may not be directly related to your career; but, it shows what kind of person your are and you will network with a wide variety of people.
